Just for giggles I've set up a launch count down timer for the release of KSP 1.0. We don't actually know what time it will be released so this is a community guessing game. You can each enter the time that you think v1 will be released and the counter will count down based on the average of what you all guess.

You can make up to 5 guesses per IP address (you don't have to log into KerbalX to guess which is why I've set the limit to IP rather than user account).

[Community Countdown Timer for v1.0's release](http://kerbalx.com/countdown)
This sounds fun, adding in my speculatatron.
It better be released in the first second of monday, otherwise I'm gonna get maaaaaaad MAAAAAAAD
05:00am GMT 0

Wow, that's an optimistic timer. It's probably going to be in the evening in mexico, as long as squad doesn't use a different timing for release. Timezones over there are -7 to -5, so i'd go for 10PM or 12PM UTC. Experience and release of the trailers point that way.

I didn't want it to display an "it's released" message unless it was actually released. Thought that might cause pandemonium. so if it hits zero before it comes out (looking more and more likely) then it just says it's not out yet and shows what our average guessed time was. When KSP does actually release I'll manually switch it to show the it's released message with links to KSP store and steam.
